description: Decimal expansion of real number x such that y = Gamma(x) is a minimum.
comments: "The gamma function has a minimum at this point. 1.461632144968362341262659542325721328468196204006446351295988409 is the solution of the equation: Psi(x)*GAMMA(x)=0. The point y of that function is 0.8856031944108887002788159005825887332079515336699034488712001659". - _Simon Plouffe_Positive root of psi(x) = 0, where psi is the digamma function. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 30 2012
links: Simon Plouffe, editor, Miscellaneous Mathematical Constants Project Gutenberg, 1996.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Gamma Function
maple: Digits:= 120; fsolve(Psi(x)=0, x); # _Iaroslav V. Blagouchine_, Feb 16 2016
mathematica: First@ RealDigits[ FindMinimum[ Gamma[x], {x, 1.4}, WorkingPrecision -> 2^7][[2, 1, 2]]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 03 2010 *)RealDigits[x /. FindRoot[PolyGamma[x], {x, 1}, WorkingPrecision -> 200]][[1]] (* _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 30 2012 *)
crossrefs: Cf. A030171 for value of y.
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
extensions: Additional comments from Francisco Salinas (franciscodesalinas(AT)hotmail.com), Dec 29 2001
